comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20110608 Firefox/4.0.1 SeaMonkey/2.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20110608 Firefox/4.0.1 SeaMonkey/2.1

When using the feed from icanhascheezeburger a duplicated folder with the same name is created is created. The duplicate folder is somehow broken, as it has no contents.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to http://feeds.feedburner.com/ICanHasCheezburger and add the feed using default settings
2. Feed items are retrieved
3. Restart Seamonkey

Actual Results:  
Two folders "I can has cheezeburger" in the feed pane

Expected Results:  
Only one folder

Happens also with a clean profile, and also happend with the 2.0 branch of Seamonkey. Please let me know if you need further information.
comments.author: berndheinze69@yahoo.de
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20110608 Firefox/4.0.1 SeaMonkey/2.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20110608 Firefox/4.0.1 SeaMonkey/2.1

When using the feed from icanhascheezeburger a duplicated folder with the same name is created is created. The duplicate folder is somehow broken, as it has no contents.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to http://feeds.feedburner.com/ICanHasCheezburger and add the feed using default settings
2. Feed items are retrieved
3. Restart Seamonkey

Actual Results:  
Two folders "I can has cheezeburger" in the feed pane

Expected Results:  
Only one folder

Happens also with a clean profile, and also happend with the 2.0 branch of Seamonkey. Please let me know if you need further information.
comments.creator: berndheinze69@yahoo.de

comments.author: alta88@fixall.com
comments.text: yep it sure does.  the reason is that the title of the feed, used for the folder name, is greater than 48 chars and ends with a ? mark, and folder creation with such a name breaks.
comments.creator: alta88@fixall.com
comments.raw_text: yep it sure does.  the reason is that the title of the feed, used for the folder name, is greater than 48 chars and ends with a ? mark, and folder creation with such a name breaks.

comments.creator: ludovic@hirlimann.net
comments.raw_text: So the issue isn't feed only , but more general. Moving to backend.
